intro: Therocistus, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. The plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of narrow, fleshy leaves and yellow composite flowers. They are often found in rocky soils and can thrive in harsh, dry environments. Therocistus species are adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and low water availability.
